byline.contributor: Omar al-Jawoshy reported from Baghdad, and Tim Arango from Istanbul. Employees of The New York Times contributed reporting from Najaf and Hilla, Iraq.
byline.original: By OMAR AL-JAWOSHY and TIM ARANGO

abstract: Iraq executes 36 men convicted of involvement in Islamic State's massacre of roughly 1,700 Shiite military personnel at Camp Speicher air base in 2014, bringing mixed reactions of joy and sorrow from families of victims.

headline.print_headline: Iraq Executes 36 Men Convicted in Islamic State’s 2014 Massacre of Shiites
headline.main: Iraq Executes Dozens for 2014 Massacre by ISIS

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Thirty-six men were hanged in connection with the group’s killing of 1,700 Shiite military personnel, despite concerns over the country’s criminal justice system....
lead_paragraph: Thirty-six men were hanged in connection with the group’s killing of 1,700 Shiite military personnel, despite concerns over the country’s criminal justice system.
